title: CAPA-001: Align All 9 Templates Between QMS and Seed

comment:
QA PRE-REVIEW: CR-098 v0.1 -- RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "CAPA-001: Align All 9 Templates Between QMS and Seed" -- present, descriptive
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" -- appropriate for v0.1

STRUCTURAL COMPLIANCE (SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present:
- Sections 1-9 (pre-approved): Purpose, Scope (2.1-2.3), Current State, Proposed State, Change Description (5.1-5.3), Justification, Impact Assessment (7.1-7.3), Testing Summary, Implementation Plan (9.1-9.5)
- Sections 10-12 (execution): EI table (8 items with VR column), Execution Comments, Execution Summary, References

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
- No draft placeholders ({{...}}) remain
- Execution placeholders ([SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], etc.) correctly present
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found

PARENT TRACEABILITY:
- Parent Document: INV-013 (CAPA-001) -- explicitly stated in Section 2.1
- Related CRs properly referenced: CR-089, CR-091, CR-095

CONTENT ASSESSMENT:
- Change Description Section 5.1 provides 12 specific schema v3-to-v5 changes for TEMPLATE-VR. Sufficiently detailed for execution.
- Section 5.2 shows exact EI table column additions for CR/ADD/VAR seed templates. Clear and actionable.
- Section 5.3 establishes QMS copy as authoritative for Category C reconciliation -- sound reasoning since those copies passed through document control.
- 8 EIs cover all 9 templates (Category C bundled into EI-6, reasonable given cosmetic nature).
- Testing Summary includes diff comparison and qms-cli test suite verification.

OBSERVATION (not a deficiency):
Lines 61, 64, 70 contain Unicode arrow character (U+2192) which caused qms_read encoding error. The character is semantically appropriate for version transition descriptions and does not appear in machine-parsed fields. This is a QMS CLI encoding limitation, not a document quality issue.

TU ASSIGNMENT: None needed. Template content alignment with no code logic changes.

QA POST-REVIEW: CR-098 v1.2 -- RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "CAPA-001: Align All 9 Templates Between QMS and Seed" -- present, descriptive
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" -- acceptable for self-authorizing executable document per SOP-002 Section 8

STRUCTURAL COMPLIANCE (SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present: Purpose, Scope (2.1-2.3), Current State, Proposed State, Change Description (5.1-5.3), Justification, Impact Assessment (7.1-7.3), Testing Summary, Implementation Plan (9.1-9.5), Execution (EI table, Execution Comments), Execution Summary, References.

EXECUTION TABLE VERIFICATION:
- 8 EIs present (EI-1 through EI-8)
- All Task Outcomes: Pass (8/8)
- No Fail outcomes, no VARs required
- VR column: blank for all EIs (none flagged during planning)
- All EIs signed by claude - 2026-02-22

CONTROLLED DOCUMENT VERIFICATION:
- TEMPLATE-VR: v3.0 EFFECTIVE (confirmed via qms_status). Revision_summary: "CR-098: Update to schema v5 (align with seed per INV-013 CAPA-001)" -- properly references authorizing CR.

TEMPLATE ALIGNMENT VERIFICATION (SOP-002 Section 7.3):
CR-098 modifies templates; verification of both QMS and seed copies required.
- TEMPLATE-VR: QMS and seed body content identical (lines 6-183). Only frontmatter revision_summary differs (QMS: CR-098, seed: CR-095) -- expected per EI-7 report.
- TEMPLATE-CR (seed): VR column present in EI table at line 400. Matches QMS copy at line 401. TEMPLATE CR PATTERNS section also propagated.
- TEMPLATE-ADD (seed): VR column present in EI table at line 144. Matches QMS copy at line 144.
- TEMPLATE-VAR (seed): VR column present in resolution work guidance at line 158. Matches QMS copy at line 158.

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found in document body
- Execution template comment blocks appropriately retained

EXECUTION SUMMARY:
Section 11 provides complete narrative covering all three template categories (A, B, C). Confirms 9 template pairs aligned with verification evidence (diff at commit 5124b4a in qms-cli). Submodule pointer updated at commit 323640d. No deviations reported.

PARENT TRACEABILITY:
- INV-013 CAPA-001 referenced in Section 2.1 and References
- Related CRs (CR-089, CR-091, CR-095) properly cited

WORKFLOW COMPLIANCE:
Audit trail confirms proper workflow: CREATE -> CHECKIN -> PRE_REVIEW (RECOMMEND) -> PRE_APPROVAL (APPROVE) -> RELEASE -> IN_EXECUTION -> checkout/checkin (2 cycles) -> POST_REVIEW. Procedurally compliant.

FINDING: COMPLIANT. All post-review criteria per SOP-002 Section 7.3 satisfied.
